results.title: Lintola: addition with carrying
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math that counts”.
Introduces two-digit addition problems, particularly problems which require regrouping. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Great diamond
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math that counts”.
Repeated division is visualized several times in this humorous animated film. The Drok tribe attempt to smuggle the Great Diamond out of their castle by breaking it into four hundred and eighty-seven pieces. They put sixteen pieces into their boot heels - but how many boots will be needed in all?

results.title: Managing difficult behaviours
results.brief_description: A series of inservice training modules on behaviour management produced by the Developmental Disabilities Staff Development Unit of the University of New England specifically for intellectual disability residential care workers. Each module is accompanied by a training manual.

results.title: Managing disobedient behaviour
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and New England Educational Diagnostic Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing difficult behaviours”.
Module 3.2. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand what disobedient behaviour is, why it occurs, how to prevent such behaviour, how to deal with disobedience which has become a regular behaviour pattern and how to manage disobedient behaviour crises. Accompanied by 45p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Managing aggressive behaviour
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and New England Educational Diagnostic Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing difficult behaviours”.
Module 3.1. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand why aggressive behaviour occurs, learn how to “get in first” to avoid aggressive outbursts and how to deal systematically with particular forms of aggressive behaviour that have become a regular behaviour pattern. Accompanied by 48p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Frontline. Series 2. One big family. Working class man. Divide the community, multiply the ratings. Changing the face of current affairs.
results.creator_credit: Jane Kennedy, Rob Sitch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Frontline TV Prod
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontline”.
In “One big family” ratings are down but the new network promo takes first priority. Mike attempts to broaden his image by becoming a “Working class man.” The Frontline team are investigating ethnic violence in “Divide the community, multiply the ratings”. A consultant is called in to help ratings in “Changing the face of current affairs.”

results.title: Frontline. Series 1. Playing the ego card. Add sex and stir. Smaller fish to fry. This night of nights
results.creator_credit: Jane Kennedy, Rob Sitch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, ABC and Frontline TV Prod
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontline”.
Four episodes from the highly acclaimed television series. In “Playing the ego card” Mike wants to boost his credibility and Brook wants the front desk. In “Add sex and stir” Mike has a busy time organising a party and the Frontline team stir up a hot story about lesbianism in sport. Will Mike stick to his guns in “Smaller fish to fry” when he investigates some top businessmen. “This night of nights” takes a look at the Logies.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Kennedy, Rob Sitch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, ABC and Frontline TV Prod

results.title: Frontline. Series 1. Desert angel. The Siege. We ain't got dames.
results.creator_credit: Jane Kennedy, Rob Sitch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontline”.
Three episodes from the highly acclaimed Australian comedy show which exposes life behind the cameras of a popular current affairs program. A beautiful aid worker believed missing in the desert is found and the Frontline staff attempt to get an exclusive in “Desert angel.” Meanwhile, another network tries to poach legendary anchorman Mike Moore. A gunman takes several hostages in a remote farmhouse, and Frontline’s questionable methods to gain a scoop boosts their ratings in “The Siege.” Frontline tries to woo back female viewers by ditching their Friday night funnyman in “We ain’t got dames.”
results.title_for_label: Frontline. Series 1. Desert angel. The Siege. We ain’t got dames.

results.title: Basic music industry skills
results.brief_description: Basic Music Industry Skills is an accredited Certificate Level Course suitable for use across the Years 9 to 12 curriculum. It is divided into modules focusing on different aspects of the music industry. Geared specifically to a teenage audience, it is nevertheless both informative and entertaining.
